intro: Metastelma quitense, commonly known as the Andean star vine, is a climbing plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its flowers are small, clustered, and typically yellow or orange in color. It produces蓇葖 (capsular) fruits that contain seeds with tufts of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes in tropical and subtropical gardens.
